title: Knapsack 0/1
description: The 0/1 Knapsack Problem is a classic optimization problem. You are given a set of items, each with a specific weight and a value. You also have a knapsack that can hold a maximum total weight `W`. Your objective is to determine the maximum total value of items you can include in the knapsack such that the total weight does not exceed the capacity `W`. You cannot break items; you must either pick an item entirely or leave it (hence 0/1).
input_format: First line: Maximum capacity W. Second line: A list of space-separated values for the items. Third line: A list of space-separated weights for the items.
output_format: Output a single integer representing the maximum total value that can be achieved within the knapsack's capacity.
